items.standfirst: BEIJING — Chinese President Xi Jinping said Wednesday that the world was facing a choice of "peace or war" and "dialogues or confrontation" as the country hosts its largest military parade commemorating the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II. items.title: Kim and Putin join Xi Jinping at massive military parade in Beijing
items.standfirst: Chinese President Xi Jinping said humanity must choose between peace and war as he held his country's largest-ever military parade on Wednesday, flanked by Russia's Vladimir Putin and North Korea's Kim Jong-un. Military hardware displayed in Beijing's Tiananmen Square included hypersonic missiles, underwater drones and a new intercontinental ballistic missile.
items.content: Chinese President Xi Jinping said humanity must choose between peace and war as he held his country's largest-ever military parade on Wednesday, flanked by Russia's Vladimir Putin and North Korea's Kim Jong-un. Military hardware displayed in Beijing's Tiananmen Square included hypersonic missiles, underwater drones and a new intercontinental ballistic missile.

items.title: How China’s XXL military parade puts its military and territorial ambitions on show
items.standfirst: Wednesday’s military parade in Beijing celebrating the 80-year anniversary of China’s victory over Japan in World War II seems set to position China as the natural leader of a rival bloc to the Western international order – while at the same time pushing a historical narrative that seeks to justify President Xi Jinping’s territorial claims on Taiwan.
items.content: Wednesday’s military parade in Beijing celebrating the 80-year anniversary of China’s victory over Japan in World War II seems set to position China as the natural leader of a rival bloc to the Western international order – while at the same time pushing a historical narrative that seeks to justify President Xi Jinping’s territorial claims on Taiwan.

items.title: Kim Jong Un joins U.S. foes in China for show of force

items.content: Chinese leader Xi Jinping welcomed Russian President Vladimir Putin as an “old friend” as the two began a series of meetings Tuesday at a time when their countries face both overlapping and differing challenges from the United States.

The parade displayed new military hardware and China's global ambitions.
Donald Trump accused Xi of conspiring against the US with Putin and Kim.
World leaders attended the parade, which included a display of China's weapons.

items.title: U.S. conducts strike on boat from Venezuela
items.standfirst: The White House released video of a lethal strike on a boat in the southern Caribbean. President Trump says the boat was carrying drugs from Venezuela and that the strike killed 11 members of a notorious gang. Tensions with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro are rapidly escalating. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has the late details.

items.title: Trump confirms U.S. strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat

items.content: President Trump says the U.S. military has struck a drug-laden vessel in the southern Caribbean after it left Venezuela. The strike comes a week after Washington deployed warships to the region.(Image credit: Daniel Gonzalez)

items.title: US conducts ‘kinetic strike’ against drug boat from Venezuela, killing 11, Trump says
items.standfirst: Trump says ‘we took it out’ referring to the operation in international waters, amid US-Caracas tensions The US military has killed 11 drug traffickers from Venezuela during a “a kinetic strike” in the Caribbean Sea, the US president, Donald Trump, has claimed amid growing tensions between Washington and Caracas.Trump trailed the announcement during an address at the White House on Tuesday afternoon, telling reporters the US had “just, over the last few minutes, literally shot out … a drug-carrying boat”. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump says ‘we took it out’ referring to the operation in international waters, amid US-Caracas tensions The US military has killed 11 drug traffickers from Venezuela during a “a kinetic strike” in the Caribbean Sea, the US president, Donald Trump, has claimed amid growing tensions between Washington and Caracas.Trump trailed the announcement during an address at the White House on Tuesday afternoon, telling reporters the US had “just, over the last few minutes, literally shot out … a drug-carrying boat”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The U.S. military conducted a strike on a Venezuelan vessel in the Caribbean.
The strike targeted a vessel allegedly involved in drug trafficking.
President Trump stated the strike killed eleven people.
The operation occurred in international waters, according to reports.
The strike is seen as a sign of escalating tensions with Venezuela.

clusters.title: Hope fades for finding survivors after Afghan quake kills more than 1,400
clusters.neutral_headline: Afghanistan Earthquake Death Toll Exceeds 1,400

items.title: Hope fades for finding survivors after Afghan quake kills more than 1,400
items.standfirst: Many victims remain trapped under the rubble, as emergency services have difficulty reaching remote villages.
items.content: Many victims remain trapped under the rubble, as emergency services have difficulty reaching remote villages.

items.title: Rescuers scramble to reach Afghan quake victims as death toll passes 1,400
items.standfirst: Emergency workers struggled on Wednesday to reach remote villages devastated by the magnitude-6.0 earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan on Sunday night as Taliban officials said the death toll had soared to more than 1,400 and aid workers warned that the number of casualties was expected to rise further.
items.content: Emergency workers struggled on Wednesday to reach remote villages devastated by the magnitude-6.0 earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan on Sunday night as Taliban officials said the death toll had soared to more than 1,400 and aid workers warned that the number of casualties was expected to rise further.

items.title: Strong aftershock hits Afghanistan after quake kills more than 1,400
items.standfirst: Many remain trapped under rubble as rescuers use helicopters in remote areas hit by recent landslides.
items.content: Many remain trapped under rubble as rescuers use helicopters in remote areas hit by recent landslides.

items.title: Afghanistan death toll passes 1,400 as second earthquake strikes
items.standfirst: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...
items.content: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...

items.title: Death toll soars past 1,400 as rescuers battle to reach earthquake survivors in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: The death toll passed 1,400 in the 6.0 magnitude earthquake that hit Afghanistan, the Taliban said, as rescuers raced to reach survivors trapped in remote areas.
items.content: The death toll passed 1,400 in the 6.0 magnitude earthquake that hit Afghanistan, the Taliban said, as rescuers raced to reach survivors trapped in remote areas.

items.title: Watch: Buildings destroyed and rescue efforts under way after deadly Afghanistan earthquake
items.standfirst: At least 800 people have been killed and thousands injured in the east of the country after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck on Sunday night.
items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and thousands injured in the east of the country after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck on Sunday night.

items.title: ‘There is death in every home’, families say, after at least 800 killed in Afghanistan earthquake – as it happened
items.standfirst: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...
items.content: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...

items.title: At least 800 dead after magnitude-6 earthquake hits eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

ai_summary: An earthquake in Afghanistan has killed over 1,400 people.
Rescuers are struggling to reach remote villages affected by the quake.
Aftershocks have further complicated rescue efforts in the region.
The Taliban has requested international aid to assist with relief efforts.
Many people remain trapped under rubble, with casualties expected to rise.

items.title: US House committee releases more than 33,000 pages of Jeffrey Epstein files
items.standfirst: Files appear to contain information already in public domain as calls grow for release of all pertinent documents The US House of Representatives oversight committee on Tuesday released thousands of pages of records related to the disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein from the department of justice.The release comes as the Trump administration has been embroiled in months of controversy over its decision not to release additional files in the case. Epstein died by suicide in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges and was alleged to have abused hundreds of girls. Continue reading...
items.content: Files appear to contain information already in public domain as calls grow for release of all pertinent documents The US House of Representatives oversight committee on Tuesday released thousands of pages of records related to the disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein from the department of justice.The release comes as the Trump administration has been embroiled in months of controversy over its decision not to release additional files in the case. Epstein died by suicide in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges and was alleged to have abused hundreds of girls. Continue reading...

items.content: A US House of Representatives committee on Tuesday released the first batch of documents from its probe into sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, posting more than 33,000 pages of Justice Department records on its website.

items.content: The House Oversight Committee on Tuesday released over 33,000 pages of documents related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. CBS News congressional correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns has more.

ai_summary: A House committee released over 33,000 pages of Epstein-related documents.

Some lawmakers are calling for a full release of all files.

clusters.title: Why did genocide scholars association say Israel’s war on Gaza is genocide?

items.title: Why did genocide scholars association say Israel’s war on Gaza is genocide?
items.standfirst: The world’s leading genocide scholars have declared that Israel’s war on Gaza meets the legal definition of genocide.
items.content: The world’s leading genocide scholars have declared that Israel’s war on Gaza meets the legal definition of genocide.

items.title: Israel prepares for new offensive in Gaza amid accusations of genocide
items.standfirst: Israel says it's identifying more targets in northern and central Gaza as its military plans to enter Gaza's largest city. The planned offensive comes just days after Israel was accused of committing genocide by the International Association of Genocide Scholars. Holly Williams has the latest.
items.content: Israel says it's identifying more targets in northern and central Gaza as its military plans to enter Gaza's largest city. The planned offensive comes just days after Israel was accused of committing genocide by the International Association of Genocide Scholars. Holly Williams has the latest.

items.title: Will resolution on Gaza by genocide scholars make a difference?
items.standfirst: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says Israel is committing genocide.
items.content: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says Israel is committing genocide.

items.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, scholars' association says
items.standfirst: The world's biggest academic association of genocide scholars has passed a resolution saying the legal criteria have been met to establish Israel is committing genocide in Gaza. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Timothy Williams, Vice President of the International Association of Genocide Scholars.
items.content: The world's biggest academic association of genocide scholars has passed a resolution saying the legal criteria have been met to establish Israel is committing genocide in Gaza. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Timothy Williams, Vice President of the International Association of Genocide Scholars.

ai_summary: The International Association of Genocide Scholars says Israel is committing genocide.
The association's resolution states legal criteria have been met in Gaza.
The association is the world's largest academic group of genocide scholars.
The resolution follows Israel's military actions in Gaza.
The association's declaration has implications for the conflict.

items.title: Google avoids breakup but must share search data with rivals, judge rules
items.standfirst: A US judge on Tuesday rejected the government's demand that Google sell its Chrome web browser as part of a major antitrust case but ordered sweeping changes to restore competition in online search. The ruling follows Judge Amit Mehta’s August 2024 finding that Google maintained illegal search monopolies through billion-dollar exclusive agreements.
items.content: A US judge on Tuesday rejected the government's demand that Google sell its Chrome web browser as part of a major antitrust case but ordered sweeping changes to restore competition in online search. The ruling follows Judge Amit Mehta’s August 2024 finding that Google maintained illegal search monopolies through billion-dollar exclusive agreements.

items.title: Google Dodges Chrome Sale in Antitrust Case, Must Share Data
items.standfirst: Alphabet Inc.’s Google will be required to share online search data with rivals while avoiding harsher penalties, including the forced sale of its Chrome business, a judge ruled in the biggest US antitrust case in almost three decades.
items.content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google will be required to share online search data with rivals while avoiding harsher penalties, including the forced sale of its Chrome business, a judge ruled in the biggest US antitrust case in almost three decades.

clusters.title: OpenAI announces parental controls for ChatGPT after teen’s suicide
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI announces parental controls for ChatGPT after teen’s suicide

items.title: OpenAI announces parental controls for ChatGPT after teen’s suicide
items.standfirst: AI company announces changes amid growing concern over the impact of chatbots on young people's mental health.
items.content: AI company announces changes amid growing concern over the impact of chatbots on young people's mental health.

items.title: OpenAI announces parental controls for ChatGPT after teen suicide lawsuit
items.standfirst: Promised protections follow reports of vulnerable users misled in extended chats.
items.content: On Tuesday, OpenAI announced plans to roll out parental controls for ChatGPT and route sensitive mental health conversations to its simulated reasoning models, following what the company has called "heartbreaking cases" of users experiencing crises while using the AI assistant. The moves come after multiple reported incidents where ChatGPT allegedly failed to intervene appropriately when users expressed suicidal thoughts or experienced mental health episodes. "This work has already been underway, but we want to proactively preview our plans for the next 120 days, so you won’t need to wait for launches to see where we’re headed," OpenAI wrote in a blog post published Tuesday. "The work will continue well beyond this period of time, but we’re making a focused effort to launch as many of these improvements as possible this year." The planned parental controls represent OpenAI's most concrete response to concerns about teen safety on the platform so far. Within the next month, OpenAI says, parents will be able to link their accounts with their teens' ChatGPT accounts (minimum age 13) through email invitations, control how the AI model responds with age-appropriate behavior rules that are on by default, manage which features to disable (including memory and chat history), and receive notifications when the system detects their teen experiencing acute distress.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: OpenAI announced parental controls for ChatGPT.
The changes follow concerns about chatbots' impact on young people.
The announcement comes after a lawsuit related to a teen's suicide.
The controls aim to protect vulnerable users.
The company is responding to growing concerns.

items.standfirst: Win for Rebecca Slaughter as court rules commissioners may not be dismissed by a president without causeA divided US appeals court on Tuesday allowed US Federal Trade Commissioner Rebecca Slaughter, a Democrat, to resume her role at the agency, as Donald Trump tries to remove her from office.In a 2-1 decision, the District of Columbia circuit court of appeals allowed a lower court decision in favor of Slaughter to take effect, rejecting the Trump administration’s request to delay the ruling during its appeal. items.title: French film star Depardieu to face trial accused of rape of actress Charlotte Arnould
items.standfirst: Film star Gerard Depardieu, one of the leading faces of French cinema, will face trial on charges of raping actress Charlotte Arnould in 2018, in the latest blow to his reputation after he was convicted of sexual assault earlier this year. Arnould first accused Depardieu of rape in 2018, saying the assaults occurred in his Paris home on two separate occasions when she was in her early 20s. Depardieu, 76, has denied wrongdoing in the case.

Depardieu, 76, has denied wrongdoing in the case.

clusters.title: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro:

items.title: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Brazil’s Supreme Court began deliberations Tuesday in the historic trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro, an ally of Donald Trump, who is accused of plotting a coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. FRANCE 24's correspondent in Brazil Jan Onozsko describes the hearing as unprecedented, marking the first time a former Brazilian president has faced such a trial.
items.content: Brazil’s Supreme Court began deliberations Tuesday in the historic trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro, an ally of Donald Trump, who is accused of plotting a coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. FRANCE 24's correspondent in Brazil Jan Onozsko describes the hearing as unprecedented, marking the first time a former Brazilian president has faced such a trial.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro faces justice over alleged attempt to usurp Brazilian democracy
items.standfirst: Former president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after losing 2022 electionBrazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro and seven of his allies, including four senior members of the military, have gone on trial for allegedly attempting to stage a coup – the first time in Brazilian history such powerful figures have faced justice for seeking to topple the country’s democracy.Bolsonaro, a paratrooper turned far-right populist who governed from 2019 until 2023, stands accused of masterminding a failed power grab after losing the 2022 election to the leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after losing 2022 electionBrazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro and seven of his allies, including four senior members of the military, have gone on trial for allegedly attempting to stage a coup – the first time in Brazilian history such powerful figures have faced justice for seeking to topple the country’s democracy.Bolsonaro, a paratrooper turned far-right populist who governed from 2019 until 2023, stands accused of masterminding a failed power grab after losing the 2022 election to the leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...

Bolsonaro is accused of plotting a coup.

The trial concerns events after the 2022 election.

items.title: Italy considers hiding state flight paths after jamming of von der Leyen plane
items.standfirst: EU member states debate how to make leaders’ flights more secure as Russia blamed for GPS lossItaly is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said.Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite navigation aids, delaying its arrival in Plovdiv, and reportedly forcing it to circle an airport for an hour. Continue reading...
items.content: EU member states debate how to make leaders’ flights more secure as Russia blamed for GPS lossItaly is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said.Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite navigation aids, delaying its arrival in Plovdiv, and reportedly forcing it to circle an airport for an hour. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A plane carrying Ursula von der Leyen was GPS jammed.
The incident occurred over Bulgaria.
NATO is working to prevent Russian GPS jamming.
Italy is considering hiding state flight paths.
Russia is being blamed for the GPS disruption.

clusters.title: Vogue Names Chloe Malle New US Editor, Succeeding Anna Wintour
clusters.neutral_headline: Vogue Names Chloe Malle New US Editor, Succeeding Anna Wintour:

items.title: Vogue Names Chloe Malle New US Editor, Succeeding Anna Wintour
items.standfirst: Condé Nast’s Vogue magazine named Chloe Malle as the head of US editorial content and the successor to Anna Wintour, who led the magazine for nearly four decades and elevated it further as a fashion powerhouse.
items.content: Condé Nast’s Vogue magazine named Chloe Malle as the head of US editorial content and the successor to Anna Wintour, who led the magazine for nearly four decades and elevated it further as a fashion powerhouse.

items.title: Vogue names Chloe Malle as new head of US edition
items.standfirst: Vogue staffer Malle succeeds Anna Wintour with the title ‘head of editorial content’ The biggest job in fashion has finally been filled.Following news that Anna Wintour was stepping back as editor of American Vogue in July, Condé Nast have appointed 39-year-old journalist and Vogue staffer Chloe Malle as head of editorial content at the American fashion magazine. Her role is effective immediately. Continue reading...
items.content: Vogue staffer Malle succeeds Anna Wintour with the title ‘head of editorial content’ The biggest job in fashion has finally been filled.Following news that Anna Wintour was stepping back as editor of American Vogue in July, Condé Nast have appointed 39-year-old journalist and Vogue staffer Chloe Malle as head of editorial content at the American fashion magazine. Her role is effective immediately. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Chloe Malle is the new head of US Vogue editorial content.
She succeeds Anna Wintour in the role.
Malle is a staffer at Vogue.
The appointment is effective immediately.
Wintour led Vogue for nearly four decades.
